Gaining a city on the Coast has given your civilization insight into navigating the waves.
Discovering a natural wonder has inspired your people with the majesty of the universe.
Farming a resource has given you an appreciation of the importance of irrigating your crops.
After finally killing an enemy with a Slinger, you long for a stronger ranged weapon.
After meeting another civilization you see the need for new ways to communicate.
Quarrying a resource has given you the raw materials you need to employ masons.
Your fights with Barbarians highlight the need for stronger weaponry.
Your mining operations have given you the ability to create an axle. Will the wheel follow?
Your fishermen are learning how to guide their travels based on studying the night sky.
Your [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route directly exchanges goods, but a medium of exchange would make trade more flexible.
With animals now domesticated into Pastures, it is time to learn to ride.
Access to a steady source of Iron has enabled you to build better weapons and stronger armor.
Constructing a squadron of Galleys has taught you much about building larger ships.
Your district planners have worked out the basics of geometry. Maybe a full mathematical system will follow soon?
Work on the Water Mill has taught your workers much about construction practices.
Completing walls around your city demonstrated the principles of engineering needed for Aqueducts and Catapults.
Your spearmen are proving effective, but now your opponents are stronger and faster. Perhaps a longer weapon is needed?
With raw materials now coming in from a wide variety of mines, the need to better teach new craftsmen to use them is essential.
The feudal lords in your realm want a champion to defend their lands. Perhaps mounting an armored warrior will do the trick?
You look to machinery to improve the performance of your sizable contingent of ranged troops.
The teachings from your Great Scientist have inspired a renewed interest in learning in your realm.
Your military leaders carefully followed the progress on your aqueduct. They see new ways to use these engineering skills.
Our new government’s defense minister suggests that we might want to build impressive defenses to protect our bustling capital.
With so many ships leaving the harbors of your empire you long to document your explorations.
Now that you have a ready supply of standardized boards, your shipping industry will soon take off.
Your emerging guilds have plans that require a large influx of gold. Perhaps we can find a way to let them take out a loan?
Your men at the armory are fashioning a new weapon that will devastate opponents.
Out of necessity your scholars are devising methods for quickly copying books.
The success of your Musketmen on land has spurred a new idea: what if we upgrade to gunpowder weaponry at sea?
Your scientists are hiking into the mountains for a sharper view of the heavens. Maybe a permanent facility would help?
With so many Crossbowmen in the field, we’ve had a lot of practice studying ranged weapons.
After creating bombards you realize that castles are not impregnable – you need a stauncher defense!.
The busy workshops of your empire hint at greatness to come. Is an Industrial Revolution about to commence?
The dawning of an age of enlightenment in our realm has sparked a serious discourse on our scientific methods.
Your cities have been protected by multiple fortifications, what if they could be defended by cannons?
Your valiant Knight has vanquished his foe. Let us learn from this victory and become students of military affairs.
Let us apply our industrial acumen to your newly-constructed shipyards. Steam-powered naval vessels could rule the seas.
With the introduction of neighborhoods, our cities are growing larger than ever before. Developing a sanitation plan is crucial.
The power of your banks in on the rise. It is time to formally study the forces that are shaping your national economy.
With a source of niter, your firearms industry is switching into top gear. The next step will be to improve our accuracy.
Having completed a modern wonder, our engineers are sure they can tackle anything. What, are they thinking of flying next?
Your armament makers are tired of having to hand craft so many muskets. Perhaps some standardization would help?
Your coal-powered blast furnaces should soon allow us to produce the finest-grade steel.
Your crafty privateers are intrigued by the discovery of electric current. Could they use this to create stealthy propulsion?
Your new national park needs visitors. Perhaps a new form of communications will help advertise it?
Joining forces with other nations has started a chain reaction of scientific advances. Will the next push be in chemistry?
Your archaeologist has noticed petroleum seeping out of the rocks. Perhaps your geologists would like to take a look?
Your extensive experience with biplanes has led to several aeronautic breakthroughs.
Development of new power plants has spurred on industrial advances that could help your armament production.
Now that you know how to build portable airstrips on land, why not try one at sea?
Having a source of petrochemicals should lead to many advances. Its plasticity is of particular interest.
A modern government comes with a lot of bureaucracy. Developing ways to efficiently track data will be a huge help.
With facilities for aircrafts in multiple cities, your aeronautic industry is taking off.
With your pioneers in radio and television leading the way, you’ve grown adept at transmitting data quickly.
Your military has defeated an enemy plane. Now it is time to have the best defense against enemy aircraft.
Tanks have been the backbone of your army so your scientists are striving for a more advanced model.
Having a diverse set of metals to experiment on will help your scientists push into new fields.
